[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., nested clauses, archaic phrasing).

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between anecdotes (e.g., Colonial squatter to "free-born" bookman).
[STRUCTURE]: Minor disjointedness in paragraph connections (e.g., detective stories tangent).

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex, convoluted sentence structures (e.g., "He is proudly conscious...")
[LEXICON]: Archaic phrasing ("gay world," "sinewy English style") may impede modern readability

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, anachronistic interruptions ("The AI assistant adjusted the lights." / "A power cycle reset the panel.")
